reasoning: Right-sided heart failure (cor pulmonale) measured as prevalence, not incidence (chronic condition). Estimated ~600 per 100k based on literature indicating right-sided HF comprises 10-30% of all HF cases, with general HF prevalence ~25-30 per 1000 population. Confidence moderate due to limited epidemiological studies specifically on right-sided HF subtype; typically secondary to pulmonary hypertension or chronic lung disease.
